definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)

sentences.english: However, Real Madrid are a great club as well, as they wear white like Santos - but Catalunya and Barcelona have a place in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 然而我的心中永远有加泰罗尼亚和巴塞罗那的位置。

sentences.english: Mr. Bellès, who is Catalan, lives in Cadaqués all year long.
sentences.chinese: 贝勒先生是加泰罗尼亚人，并长年居住在卡得奎。

sentences.english: Ferrari drivers Felipe Massa and Kimi Raikkonen were the fastest drivers at Circuit de Catalunya today.
sentences.chinese: 法拉利马萨和莱克宁是加泰罗尼亚第二天的最快车手。

sentences.english: Barça has taken the role of Catalunya's national team.
sentences.chinese: 巴萨充当了加泰罗尼亚国家队的角色。

sentences.english: On Catalonian cars you will easily discover signs of the Catalonian Donkey.
sentences.chinese: 在加泰罗尼亚汽车上，不难发现这样的标志。

sentences.english: Amaia after breaking up with Rafa, fells in love with a Catalonian.
sentences.chinese: Amaia了拉法打破后，爱上了一个加泰罗尼亚。

definition: variant of 馬德里|马德里[Ma3 de2 li3], Madrid
Galicia, province and former kingdom of northwest Spain
Barca (nickname for FC Barcelona)/Baza (town in Grenada, Spain)
Castilla, old Spanish kingdom/modern Spanish provinces of Castilla-Leon and Castilla-La Mancha
Málaga, Spain/Malaga city in Iranian East Azerbaijan
